text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*ExtensionNHS communication preferences for a resource
extension 0..*ExtensionSlice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:language 1..1ExtensionLanguages which may be used for communication
url 1..1uri"language"
value[x] 1..1CodeableConceptLanguages which may be used for communication
Binding: UK Core Human Language (extensible)
extension:preferred 0..1ExtensionLanguage preference indicator
url 1..1uri"preferred"
value[x] 1..1booleanIndicates whether or not this language is preferred (over other languages up to a certain level)
extension:modeOfCommunication 0..*ExtensionMode of communication for the selected language
url 1..1uri"modeOfCommunication"
value[x] 1..1CodeableConceptA valueset to describe the mode the patient can communicate in, representing the method of expression of the language.
Binding: UK Core Language Ability Mode (extensible)
extension:communicationProficiency 0..1ExtensionThe level of proficiency in communicating a language
url 1..1uri"communicationProficiency"
value[x] 1..1CodeableConceptA valueset to describe the level of proficiency in communicating a language
Binding: UK Core Language Ability Proficiency (extensible)
extension:interpreterRequired 0..1ExtensionInterpreter preference indicator
url 1..1uri"interpreterRequired"
value[x] 1..1booleanIndicates whether an interpreter is required for communication purposes
url 1..1uri"https://fhir.nhs.uk/R4/StructureDefinition/Extension-UKCore-NHSCommunication"
value[x] 0..0

Documentation for this format

name: ExtensionUKCoreNHSCommunication
title: Extension UK Core NHS Communication
description: An extension to support the communication preferences for an individual.
purpose: This extension has been developed to support the communication preferences for a resource in the NHS.

element.short: NHS communication preferences for a resource
element.definition: Communication preferences including a list of Languages which may be used for communication.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
